link.synopsis: Special agent Derrick Vann (Samuel L. Jackson), a hard-nosed Fed, and Andy Fidler (Eugene Levy), a milquetoast salesman, might have been brought together by accident. But they make up an unlikely crime-fighting team in this hilarious comedy. The two must work together to hunt down a dangerous man who might be responsible for the death of Vann's longtime partner. But can straitlaced Fidler rise to the occasion?
link.title: synopsis
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: Gathering to celebrate Christmas together for the first time in four years, the Whitfield clan uses the opportunity to air their true feelings about one another in this ensemble film that fuses family drama, comedy and holiday cheer. Small arguments over traditions such as trimming the tree erupt into major conflicts that test the family's bonds, making this Christmas the most memorable yet. Delroy Lindo, Mekhi Phifer and Regina King co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Christmas Unwrapped: The History of Christmas
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys

link.synopsis: Five years after his wife, Ellen (Doris Day), disappears at sea in a plane crash, successful lawyer Nick Arden (James Garner) decides it's time to move on: He has Ellen declared legally dead, remarries and sets off on his honeymoon. But there's trouble in paradise when Ellen -- who's in fact very much alive -- turns up to surprise the newlyweds. Day earned a Golden Globe nod for her performance in this update of the 1940 comedy My Favorite Wife.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: By the Light of the Silvery Moon
Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
A Guide for the Married Man
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: Four grown siblings return to their North Carolina hometown to visit their mother (Sally Field) on her deathbed, but each handles the situation differently: Emily (Julianne Nicholson) devours self-help books; Keith (Ben Chaplin) floats through events in a haze; Barry (Tom Cavanagh) won't stop working; and Matthew (Glenn Howerton) seems disengaged. This poignant comedy is based on writer-director Steve Stockman's personal experience.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
The Ballad of Jack and Rose

link.synopsis: Laughter and love rule as Geraldine "Gerry" Granger finds the man of her dreams in this special two-episode collection from the popular BBC comedy starring Dawn French as the titular clergywoman. In "The Handsome Stranger," Gerry opposes the invasion of Dibley by townies -- until she meets Harry (Richard Armitage). And in "The Vicar in White," Gerry and Harry's wedding, as planned by the eccentric townspeople, promises to be a unique affair.
link.title: synopsis
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
French & Saunders: Living in a Material World
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
French & Saunders: Gentlemen Prefer French & Saunders
Keeping Up Appearances: Life Lessons from Onslow
As Time Goes By: Reunion Specials
To the Manor Born: Silver Wedding Anniversary
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
As Time Goes By: You Must Remember This
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
The Pat Paulsen Half a Comedy Hour
Cadfael: The Raven in the Foregate

title.regular: The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending
title.short: The Vicar of Dibley: Wholly Happy Ending

link.synopsis: While investigating the accidental death of revered war hero Robert Forrest, intrepid reporter Stevie O'Malley (Spencer Tracy) meets the man's wife (Katharine Hepburn) and learns a surprising truth about his subject's supposedly "patriotic" past. George Cukor directs this politically charged wartime thriller that marks Tracy and Hepburn's second onscreen partnership, just a year after their first pairing in the romantic comedy Woman of the Year.
link.title: synopsis
The Lives of a Bengal Lancer

link.synopsis: In the screen adaptation of David E. Talbert's hit play, Desirae Baxter gets fed up with the duplicitous ways of her cheating boyfriend, Tyree Jackson, so she teams up with her friends to concoct an ingenious scheme to teach him a lesson.
link.title: synopsis
What I Like About You: Season 1
He Say, She Say, But What Does God Say?
Celebrating the Art of the Short Film

link.synopsis: Mark Cahill is a good family man with a loving wife and two wonderful children. Mark also happens to be a hit man who is haunted by his last victim, a blonde, who keeps appearing in his bedroom at the worst of times.
link.title: synopsis
Dark Shadows: The Complete Revival Series
Cannibal Women in the Avocado Jungle of Death
Molly and Roni's Dance Party: Vol. 1: 1970s Dance Mania
Molly and Roni's Dance Party: Vol. 2: 1950s Sock Hop

link.synopsis: Michelle Malloy (Leighanne Littrell) is in Orlando, Fl., visiting her sick mother. She's also engaged to be married, but when she makes some startling discoveries about her fiancé, her life is thrown into a tailspin. When Malloy meets pet shop owner Keeler (James Berlau) and his loveable inventory, there's an immediate spark. Now, Keeler must keep her from the altar in this romantic comedy featuring music by Backstreet Boy Brian Littrell.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon

link.synopsis: Comedy legend Fred Allen stars as flea circus owner Fred Floogle, who auctions off what he believes to be 5 ordinary chairs inherited from an uncle. Only after the sale does he learn that one chair was stuffed with $300,000 in cash. His quest to retrieve the loot leads to slapstick encounters with Jack Benny, Robert Benchley, Jerry Colonna and other comedy greats. The film is based on the same novel that inspired Mel Brooks' 1971 film.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Set against the glitz and glamour of the French Riviera, this comedy follows the misadventures of a father and daughter con artist team (Ronald Squire and Peggy Cummins) who pose as a married couple and swindle wealthy clients at the region's swankiest resorts. But their scams take on a whole new dimension when daughter Clare falls for a British government bureaucrat (Terence Morgan) who may have a secret or two of his own.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Pilot Alistar Pennington (Benjamin Whitrow) was just 18 years old when he lost his way on his first mission and unloaded his bombs over a German village. More than 60 years later, he's embarked on a journey of atonement -- and this time his son (Shane Taylor) is behind the wheel. With his wife riding shotgun and his idiot offspring charting the course, a hellish road trip ensues in this bittersweet comedy from director Paul Cotter.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
A Film with Me in It
The Bombing of Germany: American Experience
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle

link.synopsis: Generation X neighbors share their bittersweet, intertwined stories of the single life in director Cameron Crowe's quirky relationship comedy set against the backdrop of Seattle's grunge music scene in the 1990s. The film boasts a killer soundtrack with cuts from Pearl Jam, Soundgarden, Alice in Chains and more and features Bridget Fonda, Campbell Scott, Kyra Sedgwick, Matt Dillon and Pearl Jam's Eddie Vedder (in a cameo role as a rocker).
link.title: synopsis
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition

link.synopsis: Christopher Walken shines in this cult-favorite dark comedy as Charlie, a former mobster who is abducted by five privileged young men (Sean Patrick Flanery, Johnny Galecki, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Henry Thomas) desperate to raise a $2 million ransom to save the sister of a friend. As Charlie plays mind games, however, his captors splinter -- each wondering whether one of their own had a hand in the crime.
link.title: synopsis
King of New York: Special Edition
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken

link.synopsis: When self-involved Dede Truitt -- a manipulative 16-year-old tart -- moves in with her gay half-brother and his lover, she quickly seduces her way into a gender-bending love triangle in this saucy black comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: In this Brad Silberling-helmed comedy, Bill Pullman plays James Harvey, a ghost doctor hired by Carrigan Crittendon (Cathy Moriarty) to rid Whipstaff Manor of spirits so she can find a treasure trove rumored to be hidden there. But her plan backfires when James's daughter Kat (Christina Ricci) befriends Casper, the friendly phantom who inhabits the place along with The Ghostly Trio, who disdain humans. Includes games, featurettes and more.
link.title: synopsis
The Haunted Pumpkin of Sleepy Hollow
The Spooktacular New Adventures of Casper: Vol. 2
Casper & Wendy: Scare Up Some Fun
It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia

link.synopsis: This fish-out-of-water comedy romp stars Tim Allen as an uptight New York City executive who pursues his soon-to-be ex-wife (JoBeth Williams) to South America and returns home with the son he never knew he had -- a boy raised in a tribal village in Brazil. Armed with only his blowgun, the 13-year-old Mimi-Siku (Sam Huntington) discovers that the world outside his jungle home is indeed a strange place.
link.title: synopsis
A Kid in King Arthur's Court
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs

link.synopsis: Spirited young Jessica (Cécile De France), newly arrived in Paris from the provinces, lands a job as a waitress at a café, where the eccentric customers need her for counsel more than coffee in this charming French comedy. Among the regulars, art collector Jacques (Claude Brasseur) anguishes over his collection; TV star Catherine (Valérie Lemercier) longs to be in movies; and pianist Jean François (Albert Dupontel) wants to be left alone.
link.title: synopsis
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
It's Kind of a Funny Story
No One Knows About Persian Cats
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: Based on P.G. Wodehouse's popular novels, this comedy series follows Jeeves, a laconic butler who must regularly (and often clandestinely) rescue his knuckleheaded aristocratic master, Bertie Wooster, from romantic and other entanglements.
link.title: synopsis
Thank You, Jeeves / Step Lively, Jeeves!
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Lord Peter Wimsey Mysteries: The Nine Tailors
A Dance to the Music of Time
Inspector Morse 8: Ghost in the Machine
Inspector Morse 13: The Sins of the Father
Inspector Morse 7: Last Bus to Woodstock
Inspector Morse 6: The Settling of the Sun
Inspector Morse 1: The Dead of Jericho
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: Racecar-driver wannabe Belle (Queen Latifah) uses her prowess behind the wheel to become a cabbie. Thanks to her reputation for speeding through the city at insane speeds, a young cop (Jimmy Fallon) convinces her to use her skills to help him catch a gang of female bank robbers. Ann-Margret, Gisele Bündchen and Jennifer Esposito co-star in this high-speed action-comedy based on a French film written by Luc Besson.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After a loner named Clive Merser (Nick Searcy) witnesses an atrocious car accident near his desolate backcountry home in Tennessee, he becomes convinced that the dead driver, Melissa (Casey Leet), is the girl of his dreams -- and does just about anything to keep her around. Meanwhile, Melissa's sister, Cathy (Joelle Carter), and boyfriend, Daric (Matt Keeslar), frantically try to find her. Tony Elwood directs and co-writes this thriller.
link.title: synopsis
Do You Wanna Know a Secret?
Masters of Horror: John Carpenter: Pro-Life

link.synopsis: After things go south for former forensic science major Doug (Cris Lankenau), he leaves Chicago and returns home to Oregon to live with his sister, Gail (Trieste Kelly Dunn) -- and soon finds himself entangled in an unexpected situation that calls on his investigative mind. Together with Gail and his friend Carlos, Doug uses his forensic skills and the techniques he's learned as a detective fiction enthusiast to unravel the mystery he encounters.
link.title: synopsis
Page One: Inside the New York Times

link.synopsis: Convinced that there isn't enough of him to go around, overworked contractor Doug Kinney (Michael Keaton) has himself secretly cloned so he can spend more time with his wife (Andie MacDowell) and children. But the clones slowly develop ideas of their own -- and managing them turns out to be the toughest job Doug's ever had. Harold Ramis directs this screwball comedy of errors, co-starring Eugene Levy and Brian Doyle-Murray.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: Mired in marital conflict, Ben (Bruce Willis) and Katie Jordan (Michelle Pfeiffer) separate for the summer to independently evaluate their 15-year union. During the separation, they reflect on how they've changed and question their marriage's strength. After looking to friends for advice and guidance, Ben and Katie soon realize that only they can decide if their union is worth preserving. Rob Reiner directs this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Deep End of the Ocean
I Could Never Be Your Woman
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Dennis Quaid and Rene Russo take on the roles made famous by Henry Fonda and Lucille Ball in this remake of the 1968 comedy about two single parents who plan to marry and merge their broods into one "happy" family.
link.title: synopsis
Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie
Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain
VeggieTales: Duke and the Great Pie War

link.synopsis: Funnyman Tim Allen plays an out-of-practice superhero who used to turn heads as the flashy Captain Zoom. When a secret agency recruits him to turn a motley crop of teens into the next generation of good guys, he's forced to get back into shape. But can he pull off the transformation? Courteney Cox and Rip Torn also star in this lighthearted fantasy comedy based on the graphic novel Zoom's Academy for the Super Gifted.
link.title: synopsis
3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain
Superman II: The Richard Donner Cut
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Movie

link.synopsis: Just as his wife, Kay (Myrna Loy), is about to divorce him out of sheer boredom, Larry (William Powell) gets a knock on the head. Memories of his past as a con artist come flooding back, and suddenly, Kay's interest in Larry is renewed. Is it enough to keep her from divorce? And will her rekindled love survive if Larry returns to his usual dull self? Frank McHugh, Edmund Lowe and Our Gang's Carl "Alfalfa" Switzer co-star in this madcap comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Steve and Susan Ireland (William Powell and Myrna Loy) host Susan's mother (Florence Bates), who's recuperating from a sprained ankle. When a misunderstanding prompts her to goad Susan into divorce, Steve plays at being mentally ill as a defense. But Susan calls his bluff and has him committed. Gail Patrick, Sig Ruman and Jack Carson co-star in director Jack Conway's sidesplitting screwball comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: The leader of an arrogant group of privileged schoolgirls, Massie Block (Elizabeth McLaughlin) finds her life takes an unexpected turn when her parents' friends -- a middle-class family with a self-assured teenage daughter, Claire (Ellen Marlow) -- move into the Blocks's guest house. In the tradition of Mean Girls, this direct-to-video teen comedy is based on the best-selling book series by author Lisi Harrison.
link.title: synopsis
The Perv Parlor / The Frat Shack Shakedown
Bring It On: In It to Win It
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen

link.synopsis: Comedian Jim Gaffigan offers up his unique take on bacon, bowling and other weighty topics in this smart and hilarious stand-up performance filmed live in Austin at the end of his sold-out 2008 comedy tour. Known for his fond attachment to slothful and indulgent behavior, Gaffigan has garnered a huge and enthusiastic fan following. In addition to frequent appearances on late-night talk shows, he has acted in numerous films and television shows.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Bill Burr: Why Do I Do This
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
Comedians of Comedy: Live at the Troubadour
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Zach Galifianakis: Live at the Purple Onion
I Don't Know How She Does It
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck

link.synopsis: Luciano (Daniel Hendler) is devastated to learn that his friend, Manuel (Walter Jakob), is creating a television series featuring an uncomfortably familiar character named Luciano. But life changes for the narcoleptic hypochondriac when he gets a houseguest: Manuel's girlfriend (Jazmín Stuart). Set in Argentina, director Gabriel Medina's comedy follows Luciano as he reveals his softer side to his beautiful boarder.
link.title: synopsis
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: In this lighthearted comedy, the life of history professor Michael Burgess gets upended when a film crew invades his town to turn his scholarly bestseller about the American Revolution into a silver-screen saga of lust, duplicity and intrigue.
link.title: synopsis
To Be or Not To Be

link.synopsis: Join Molly, her trusted dolly friend Loonette and the rest of the gang on the gargantuan couch and learn all about the holiday season in this PBS favorite. Kids will learn about wrapping presents and the joy of gift giving, and will watch in delight as Snicklefritz and Grandma Garbanzo make a snow clown and explore why Christmas Eve is "the longest night of the year."
link.title: synopsis
Bear in the Big Blue House: Storytelling with Bear
Blue's Clues: Blue's Room: Alphabet Power
Blue's Clues: Blue's Room: Meet Blue's Baby Brother

title.regular: The Big Comfy Couch: Comfy & Joy / Jump for Joy
title.short: Big Comfy Couch: Comfy & Joy/Jump for Joy

link.synopsis: Catch two episodes of the award-winning public television series for children that features the adventures of Loonette the clown, Molly the Dolly and a host of other cheerful characters. In "You Can Do It Molly," Loonette helps Molly face her fear of climbing the steps of Granny Garbanzo's house. In "I Feel Good," Loonette and Molly calm Major Bedhead's concerns over his big belly and celebrate the parts of their bodies they like the most.

title.short: Big Comfy Couch: You Can Do It/I Feel Good

link.synopsis: Energetic clown Loonette and her dolly Molly return to their big comfy couch in this collection of episodes from the award-winning children's television series. Kids will delight in the magical couch, which holds everything in the world inside of it -- an umbrella, a fluffy doggy, even the kitchen sink! Episodes feature Loonette teaching at Clowndergarten; the clown pretending she's a kitty; and a day of everyone in Clowntown losing things.

title.short: The Big Comfy Couch: Clown in the Round

link.synopsis: Fun-loving clown Loonette spends her time playing with her friend Molly the dolly on the big comfy couch, which always has lots of surprises in store. Presented from a preschooler's point of view, this award-winning series is filled with games, reading, fun and education. In this collection of episodes, Molly plays checkers; Loonette decides her arms and legs are "floppy"; and everyone talks in "Fibberish Gibberish."

link.synopsis: Take a seat on the Big Comfy Couch, where it's party time for clown Loonette and her dolly Molly as they sing, tell stories, play games and have fun. This volume of three episodes features Loonette at Granny Garbanzo's surprise party, a day of popcorn fun and clowns learning about loud and quiet. Preschoolers will laugh and learn as they visit Clowntown and the characters of this popular educational PBS television series.

title.short: The Big Comfy Couch: Let's Have a Party

link.synopsis: Energetic clown Loonette and her friend Molly return to the Big Comfy Couch in this volume of episodes from the award-winning children's series. Kids will delight as Loonette gets a case of the grumpies, Molly wins a game of "Can You Do What I Do?" and Loonette learns that she's in control of her wiggling and giggling. Preschoolers will laugh and learn as they visit Clowntown and the enormous couch that holds everything in the entire world.

title.regular: The Big Comfy Couch: Wiggling and Giggling
title.short: The Big Comfy Couch: Wiggling and Giggling

link.synopsis: Climb up onto the Big Comfy Couch with Loonette the clown and her dolly friend of few words, Molly, in this fifth volume of themed episodes from the popular PBS kids' series. There's fun in every direction when Loonette helps Granny bake up an upside-down cake packed with cabbage and pickles, and Molly makes friends with an upside-down doll. Loonette and Molly also learn all about the letter M -- which, upside down, looks a lot like the letter W.
link.title: synopsis
Tinker Bell and the Great Fairy Rescue

Dragon Tales: Sing and Dance in Dragonland
Dragon Tales: Playing Fair Makes Playing Fun
Bear in the Big Blue House: Shapes, Sounds & Colors with Bear
Wow! Wow! Wubbzy!: Wubbzy Goes Green
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 4
The Berenstain Bears: Fun Family Adventures
Mickey Mouse Clubhouse: Mickey's Great Clubhouse Hunt

title.regular: The Big Comfy Couch: Upside Down Clown
title.short: The Big Comfy Couch: Upside Down Clown

link.synopsis: After a multiyear hiatus, venerable funnyman-about-town Sinbad hits the stage hard, delivering the lowdown but keeping it clean in this housequaking stand-up special presented by Comedy Central. Named one of Comedy Central's "100 Greatest Stand-ups of All Time," Sinbad is in his element as he speaks truth to the burning subjects of the day, from poverty and politics to where he's been keeping himself all this time.
link.title: synopsis
Sinbad: Son of a Preacher Man
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 1: Best of the Uptown Comics
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Kevin Hart: I'm a Grown Little Man
Platinum Comedy Series: Sheryl Underwood: Too Much Information
Dana Carvey: Squatting Monkeys Tell No Lies
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Donnell Rawlings: From Ashy to Classy
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough

link.synopsis: In addition to the usual high school curriculum, Baxter takes classes in stand-up comedy at Northern Star School of the Arts. The extroverted teen does what he can to stand out amid friends studying music, dance, acting, and other performing arts.
link.title: synopsis
Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega
Sabrina, the Teenage Witch: The Animated Series
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
The Suite Life of Zack & Cody

link.synopsis: In this dark comedy, writer and director Shem Bitterman brings his 1998 play of the same name to the big screen with Patrick Flueger ("4400") starring as a con man trying to go straight so that he can marry the girl of his dreams. Trouble comes in the form of a slick-tongued temp agent (Joe Pantoliano) who helps the love-struck con land a job but neglects to fill him in on all the details. Ron Perlman and Taryn Manning also star.
link.title: synopsis
The Conspiracy to Rule the World: From 911 to the Illuminati
The City of Your Final Destination
The Last Days of Frankie the Fly

link.synopsis: Overjoyed to have finally signed their divorce papers, incessantly bickering doctor Roger (Tom Conti) and lawyer Jean (Teri Garr) are thrown back into each other's lives when a bungling jewel thief kidnaps them and takes them to the jungles of South America. But helping a sick indigenous woman and experiencing life's other little miracles gives the couple a second shot at true love. Jim Kouf directs this heartwarming comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: The Wayans brothers (who split a Razzie Award for Worst Actor) star in this outrageous comedy about a man (Shawn Wayans) so eager to become a dad that he'll believe anything, including the notion that a baby-faced thief (Marlon Wayans) on the lam is really an abandoned toddler. Toting the "boy" home to his wife (Kerry Washington), the proud papa unwittingly serves as an accomplice to his new son's string of crimes.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood
I Think I Love My Wife
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: Stand-up powerhouse Earthquake shakes up the audience with his no-holds-barred observations of urban life in this sizzling HBO comedy performance. Earthquake shocks the New York crowd with one gut-busting quip after another. A featured headliner at the Crown Royal Comedy Soul Fest, Earthquake has also performed on Comedy Central and with "The Super Stars of Comedy" tour.
link.title: synopsis
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Earthquake Presents: From the Outhouse to the White House
Platinum Comedy Series: Sheryl Underwood: Too Much Information
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Latham Entertainment Presents: An All New Comedy Experience
Platinum Comedy Series: Bruce Bruce: Live
Platinum Comedy Series: The Good, The Badd, The Funny

Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!
Tess: Looking for My Next Ex-Husband

Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
Live from the Laugh Factory: Vol. 1

Rod Z: I Ain't Lied Yet!

Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place

link.synopsis: Macaulay Culkin returns as Kevin McCallister in this wintry flick, winner of a People's Choice Comedy Award. Instead of flying to Florida with his folks, Kevin ends up alone in New York, where he gets a hotel room with his dad's credit card -- despite problems from a clerk (Tim Curry) and meddling bellboy (Rob Schneider). But when Kevin runs into his old nemeses (Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern), he's determined to foil their plans to rob a toy store.
link.title: synopsis
Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief

title.regular: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
title.short: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York

link.synopsis: Walter Matthau stars as the grumbling, beer-guzzling Morris Buttermaker, a former minor-league pitcher roped into coaching a crass bunch of perpetually losing half-pint misfits. Desperate to win, Coach Morris brings in two ringers. One is his ex-girlfriend's athletic daughter, Amanda (Tatum O'Neal), and the other the rebellious but talented Kelly (Jackie Earle Haley). Director Michael Ritchie's kids' sports comedy catapulted the genre's popularity.
link.title: synopsis
The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training
The Bad News Bears Go to Japan!
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings

link.synopsis: In this feel-good comedy, Bill Rago (Danny DeVito), an unemployed advertising executive, accepts a job teaching English to a group of idiotic Army privates. Rago eventually converts them and makes a positive impact on their personal lives in the process. How? By using the seductive iambic pentameter of William Shakespeare, of course. Penny Marshall directs; Gregory Hines and Ed Begley Jr. co-star.
link.title: synopsis
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit

link.synopsis: When Catherine (Meg Ryan), the cerebral niece of scientific genius Albert Einstein (Walter Matthau), piques the interest of an average auto mechanic (Tim Robbins), Einstein concocts a plan to bring the two divergent minds together in this lighthearted romantic comedy. But can a guy who works with his hands win a girl ruled by her brain? Einstein bends the laws of attraction to make it work. Stephen Fry co-stars as Catherine's stuffy fianc.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this black comedy, Elvis Presley (Bruce Campbell) is an elderly resident in an East Texas rest home who switched identities with an impersonator years before his "death" and missed his chance to switch himself back. When the King teams up with a fellow resident (Ossie Davis) who thinks he's John F. Kennedy, the two old codgers prepare to battle an evil Egyptian entity that's chosen their long-term care facility as its happy hunting grounds.
link.title: synopsis
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
Jack of All Trades: The Complete Series
The Adventures of Brisco County, Jr.: The Complete Series
From Dusk Till Dawn 2: Texas Blood Money
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny
Blood Feast 2: All U Can Eat

link.synopsis: Shy teen Jonathan Bellah (Doug McKeon) goes from gawky to cocky when he starts hanging out with cool new neighbor Gene Harbrough (Chris Nash), whose "guidance" includes taking his protégé on escapades with fast cars and fast women. Meanwhile, Jonathan lusts after the sexy Marilyn (Kelly Preston). Set in 1956, this amiable comedy co-stars Catherine Mary Stewart and Jami Gertz, and features the music of Chuck Berry, Elvis Presley and Buddy Holly.
link.title: synopsis
Before the Devil Knows You're Dead
Angels / Getting into Heaven: Double Feature
Citizen Toxie: The Toxic Avenger IV
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Newlyweds Nick and Suzanne (Ice Cube and Nia Long) move into a big fixer-upper in the suburbs, but their happy new life together is thrown into disarray by an oddball contractor (John C. McGinley) who bonds with Suzanne and her two children as the renovation project escalates. Feeling alienated and angry, Nick plans some wild schemes to win back his family's respect in this sequel to the popular comedy Are We There Yet?
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Three Men and a Little Lady
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas

link.synopsis: After his wife dies, reserved septuagenarian Alfredo (Manuel Alexandre) moves into a small Madrid apartment, where sparks fly with his neighbor Elsa (China Zorrilla), a fiery 82-year-old widow who christens him "Fred." Elsa's wild insouciance lures Fred into a whirlwind romance -- and a celebration of life -- in this award-winning romantic comedy from Spain and Argentina.
link.title: synopsis
The Other Side of the Street
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras
El Lado Oscuro del Corazon II

link.synopsis: In this animated comedy from Spain, clumsy lynx Felix and his animal pals try to thwart the plans of Noah, a rich man who wants to collect pairs of endangered animals and keep them in a vast ship where they will be safe from extinction. But when Felix, Gus the chameleon, Astart the hawk and their friends elude capture, Noah hires a professional hunter to track and snare them. Raul Garcia and Manuel Sicilia direct this kid-friendly film.
link.title: synopsis
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild
Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore

link.synopsis: In this British action-comedy, Samuel L. Jackson stars as Elmo McElroy, a kilt-wearing, golf-obsessed illegal chemist who arrives in Liverpool to clinch a $20 million drug deal. However, McElroy's former boss (Meat Loaf) has sent a skilled assassin (Emily Mortimer) after him. With a skinhead gang and the cops also hounding him, McElroy teams up with Yank-hating small-time hood Felix (Robert Carlyle) to seal the deal before anyone can off him.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man

link.synopsis: Self-billed "happy hooker" Xaviera Hollander (Martine Beswick) conquers Tinseltown in this campy 1980 comedy based on her memoirs detailing her adventures in the sex trade. Xaviera wants to make a movie inspired by her larger-than-life life, but there are hurdles. Hollywood is overrun with crooks, incompetents and scoundrels she must vanquish with confidence and charm. Adam West co-stars as a sleazy producer.
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington

link.synopsis: When his degree is found bogus, cocky lawyer Jeff Winger (Joel McHale) is sent back to the local community college, where he meets befuddled students and instructors whose credentials are as dubious as his own. Winger forms a study group to be near Britta (Gillian Jacobs) but gains a grab bag of other pals, including moist-towelette tycoon Pierce Hawthorne (Chevy Chase) and Abed (Danny Pudi), a film student with Asperger's.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 2
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey

link.synopsis: Before he became typecast as a B-movie villain, Eric Roberts starred in this offbeat comedy directed by Yugoslav filmmaker Dusan Makavejev. Sent by his Coca-Cola bosses to do market research in Australia's outback, a young executive (Roberts) finds himself butting heads with a local soda magnate (Bill Kerr). Before long, however, the American expatriate succumbs to the charms of both the outback attitude and a local beauty (Greta Scacchi).
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

link.synopsis: A college coed gets mixed up with dangerous criminals in this vintage B drama. When his university-going daughter Brenda (Tina Thayer) begins seeing a gangster named Nick (Rick Vallin), Brenda's district attorney father, Reynolds (Otto Kruger), won't stand for it. But the DA dad takes the role of protective pop a bit too far when he has Nick killed, and in an ironic twist of fate, Brenda is accused of the murder.
link.title: synopsis
Sin You Sinners / Dance Hall Racket: Double Feature
The Show Off / The Plastic Age
Gene Autry Collection: Down Mexico Way
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee

link.synopsis: This colorful anime series chronicles what happens when an unrequited love from the past rekindles itself in the present, setting off a chain reaction of fantastic events. Forbidden from being with his beloved centuries ago, Yusuke Takasaki unexpectedly finds himself reincarnated as a student at the Kanenone boys academy. Will the arrival of visitors from an all-girls school fulfill the destiny of a lifetime?
link.title: synopsis
Agent Aika Anime Legends: Re-Mastered Complete Collection
Ninja Nonsense: The Legend of Shinobu
Ah My Buddha: Vol. 6: The Six Realms Below
Ah My Buddha: Vol. 5: The Five Bare Aggregates
All Purpose Cultural Cat Girl Nuku Nuku Dash
Ah My Buddha: Vol. 4: The Four Naked Truths

link.synopsis: Convinced he's a girl trapped in a boy's body, 7-year-old Ludovic (Georges Du Fresne) expresses his true self by regularly donning girls' clothing, putting a strain on his perplexed family -- and, of course, sending shockwaves among his bigoted neighbors. But Ludovic innocently carries on, oblivious to the chaos he's creating. This whimsical Belgian comedy was an international film festival smash and received a Best Foreign Film Golden Globe.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Danny DeVito directs this dark comedy set in the dog-eat-dog world of children's television, where kids' show star Rainbow Randolph (Robin Williams) gets fired over a bribery scandal and is replaced by Smoochy (Edward Norton) -- a puffy, idealistic purple rhinoceros. Randolph plots his revenge when he discovers that Smoochy is having an affair with Randolph's ex-lover, Nora (Catherine Keener), a top programming executive at the network.
link.title: synopsis
Inside the Actors Studio: Robin Williams
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny

link.synopsis: Convinced that an escaped convict is headed for his ex-girlfriend's home, a pair of detectives stake out her apartment in this buddy-cop comedy. The watch remains fairly routine ... until one of the detectives falls for the woman under surveillance.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Dexter (Kenan Thompson) and Ed (Kel Mitchell) are two Los Angeles teens who get summer jobs at Good Burger. When corporate giant Mondo Burger moves in across the street and threatens to close them down, the pair must help save their small restaurant from going under.Will Ed's special, secret sauce save Good Burger and their jobs?  Sinbad co-stars in this tasty comedy, and look for a cameo by Shaquille O'Neal.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Frankie Heck (Patricia Heaton) is a modern Midwestern mom struggling to manage her eccentric, rambunctious household in the small Indiana town where she grew up in this cheerily satirical domestic comedy. While Frankie and husband Mike (Neil Flynn) are out working, their three children -- sullen Axl, nerdy middle-schooler Sue and their socially challenged little brother, Brick -- stay busy developing unique and often frantic growing pains.
link.title: synopsis
The New Adventures of Old Christine
Everybody Loves Raymond: The Series Finale
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters

link.synopsis: This cheeky comedy centers on bank manager Naren, Web site employee Milind and playboy Abby, three optimistic suitors who do whatever it takes -- from changing their looks to switching careers -- to capture the hearts of three ultramodern women.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai

link.synopsis: With his mother facing surgery, Carlton and his friend Lucy travel to Ohio to round up his estranged father, Kyle, a baseball legend. Michael Meredith's comedy-drama follows the unlikely trio on an emotionally awkward road trip back to Texas.
link.title: synopsis
Oprah Winfrey Presents: Mitch Albom's For One More Day
It's Kind of a Funny Story

link.synopsis: Inspired by real-life madam Xaviera Hollander's memoirs, this 1977 comedy stars Joey Heatherton as a prostitute ready to defend her profession in Washington, D.C., before a Senate committee concerned by increasing promiscuity in the country. Little do they know that Hollander is a formidable opponent -- one who's happy to make the case for her sex-positive ways. George Hamilton co-stars as Hollander's attorney.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington
title.short: The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington

link.synopsis: Soon after medical student Simon Sparrow (Dirk Bogarde) arrives at St. Swithin's Hospital to begin his training, he's engulfed in a high-stakes world that includes sports cars, cocktails and women. With all these distractions, it's difficult to keep his eye on his books -- and that's where strict chief surgeon Sir Lancelot Spratt (James Robertson Justice) comes in. Ralph Thomas directs this farcical comedy, based on a novel by Richard Gordon.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall

link.synopsis: Singer-songwriter David Allan Coe, the self-described "Long-Haired Redneck," draws a crossover audience to Billy Bob's Texas in Fort Worth. With a backup band that includes his son, Tyler, Coe performs hits that made him and other artists famous. Songs include "Take This Job and Shove It," the hit he wrote for Johnny Paycheck, as well as "Heaven Only Knows," "Lay My Money Down," "If That Ain't Country" and two tunes co-written by Kid Rock.
link.title: synopsis
Merle Haggard: Live at Billy Bob's Texas
Willie Nelson: Live at Billy Bob's Texas
Outlaw Country: Live from Austin TX
Merle Haggard: Live from Austin, TX
The Highwaymen: On the Road Again
Be Here to Love Me: A Film About Townes Van Zandt
Poco: Crazy Love: The Ultimate Live Experience
Waylon Jennings: Live from Austin, TX
Johnny Cash: Live from Austin, TX
Lost Concerts Series: Presley & Cash: The Road Show
Country Music Classics: Marty Robbins and Ernest Tubb
Asleep at the Wheel: Live at Billy Bob's Texas
Freddy Fender: Live at the Renaissance Center
Country Music America: Jeannie C. Riley, Faron Young and Porter Wagoner
Gentleman Jim Reeves: The Story of a Legend

Johnny Cash: Singing at His Best
Charley Pride: Live in Concert: 15th March 1975
Johnny Cash: Ridin' the Rails: The Great American Train Story
Patsy Cline: Sweet Dreams Still: The Anthology
Lynn Anderson: Live at the Renaissance Center
The Carter Family: Will the Circle be Unbroken: American Experience
Lynn Anderson: Live from the Rose Garden

title.regular: David Allan Coe: Live at Billy Bob's Texas
title.short: David Allan Coe: Live at Billy Bob's Texas

link.synopsis: Scooby ditches Shaggy and the gang and gets the red carpet treatment in Tinseltown as a star of Westerns, musicals and comedies, with spoofs on such 1970s TV staples as "Happy Days," "The Love Boat" and "Laverne and Shirley." But back at the Mystery Machine, the gang misses their favorite mutt -- and just when things are at their bleakest, Scooby proves that he is indeed one incredible best friend you can count on.
link.title: synopsis
Scooby-Doo and the Monster of Mexico
Scooby-Doo and the Legend of the Vampire
Scooby-Doo and the Loch Ness Monster
The Best of the New Scooby-Doo Movies
Felix the Cat: Golden Anniversary Edition
Pink Panther Cartoon Collection: The Ant and the Aardvark
Will & Dewitt: My BFF (Best Frog Friend)
Martha Speaks: Martha Says It with Flowers
Martha Speaks: Martha Goes to School
Shaun the Sheep: Off the Baa!
Shaun the Sheep: Back in the Ba-a-th
Shaun the Sheep: Little Sheep of Horrors
Shaun the Sheep: Sheep on the Loose
Shaun the Sheep: A Woolly Good Time

link.synopsis: Jump in and buckle up for a wild ride in the fast lane of laughter in this sequel to one of the top action-adventure comedies ever! This time, the notorious Bandit (Burt Reynolds) and his beautiful companion Carrie (Sally Field) find themselves involved in a mission of epic proportions: transporting a pregnant elephant cross-country in 24 hrs or less! Hot on their heels is archenemy Sheriff Buford T. Justice (Jackie Gleason), who vows to finally put the Bandit behind bars.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Director Andrew Currie's imaginative horror-comedy follows the misadventures of typical boy-next-door Timmy Robinson (K'Sun Ray) and his very unusual pet -- a loyal, lumbering zombie named Fido (Billy Connolly). Problems arise when Fido breaks loose and noshes on a neighbor. Timmy is suddenly forced into damage-control mode while he tries to persuade his parents (Carrie-Anne Moss and Dylan Baker) to keep Fido.
link.title: synopsis
Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny

link.synopsis: Dave Kovic (Kevin Kline) looks so much like President Bill Mitchell that he's asked to stand in for him after the chief executive suffers an unexpected stroke -- and he's stuck in the White House till Mitchell's staff (led by an unctuous Frank Langella) can decide what to do. Dave gets into the part, passing legislation and even developing a crush on Mitchell's estranged First Lady (Sigourney Weaver). Ivan Reitman directed this charming political comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.synopsis: An angel -- The Escort (Buck Henry) -- pulls quarterback Joe Pendleton (Warren Beatty) out of his body before his time, so the forces that be decide on Joe's reincarnation: a vicious multimillionaire with a wife (Dyan Cannon) and an assistant (Charles Grodin) trying to kill him. Henry and Beatty co-direct this comedy that was nominated for eight Oscars (winning Best Art Direction); Julie Christie co-stars as Betty, Joe's love interest.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

link.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Countless wiseguy films are spoofed in this Golden Globe-nominated comedy from director Harold Ramis that centers on the neuroses and angst of a powerful Mafia racketeer who suffers from panic attacks. When Paul Vitti (Robert De Niro) needs help dealing with his role in the "family," unlucky shrink Dr. Ben Sobel (Billy Crystal) is given just days to resolve Vitti's emotional crisis and turn him into a happy, well-adjusted gangster.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold
Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
Sex and the City: The Movie
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion

link.synopsis: Bing Crosby croons to the tune of the Oscar-winning "White Christmas" in Irving Berlin's love triangle romantic comedy. Tired of the bright lights of showbiz, Jim Hardy (Crosby) retires to the countryside to become a farmer. He converts the farm into the Holiday Inn, open only on holidays, then competes against his pal (Fred Astaire) for a singer-dancer's (Marjorie Reynolds) affection.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture

link.title: Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
Birth of the Blues / Blue Skies: Double Feature
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: Jackie Chan stars as Wong Fei-Hung, whose mischievous antics land him in hot water. Having tolerated enough of his son's mishaps, Fei-Hung's dad enlists his sadistic uncle (Siu Tien Yuen), who specializes in drunken-style kung fu, to teach the lad some discipline. Directed by Woo-ping Yuen (fight choreographer for The Matrix), this Hong Kong martial-arts comedy helped establish the slapstick fighting style that would become Chan's trademark.
link.title: synopsis
Half a Loaf of Kung Fu
Jackie Chan: The Kung Fu Years / Force 5 / The Power of Aikido / Dr. Wai
Once Upon a Time in China
Black Dragon Collection: Heroes of the Wild
Deadly Snail vs. Kung Fu Killer
Crash Masters: The Dragon, the Hero
Black Dragon Collection: Yao's Young Warriors
Black Dragon Collection: Of Cooks and Kung Fu
Old Skool Killaz: Secret of the Dragon
Old Skool Killaz: Daughter of Vengeance
Wu Tang Clan Presents: Fists of Legend 2: Iron Bodyguards

link.synopsis: Settle in for a heartwarming slice-of-life comedy, as eight friends reunite at their beloved summer camp after 20 years. Overshadowing the reunion, however, is the knowledge that the camp's owner is ready to close it down forever. As they come together, the ex-campers try and relive the glory days but also must come to terms with various issues plaguing their daily lives. Alan Arkin, Bill Paxton, Diane Lane, Elizabeth Perkins and Sam Raimi star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Big-time gangster Snaps Provolone (Sylvester Stallone) promises his dying father, Eduardo (Kirk Douglas), that he'll go straight. Easier said than done, as Snaps encounters far too many setbacks in this comedy from director John Landis. There's a little black bag mix-up, a daughter who changes fiancés three times and a continuously revolving door of thugs. The all-star cast includes Tim Curry, Marisa Tomei, Chazz Palminteri and Don Ameche.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Knew Too Little
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: Peter Plunkett (Peter O'Toole), the owner of a debt-ridden Irish castle, hatches a plan to lure American tourists by advertising the place as haunted. But when Peter and his staff don sheets and chains as part of their ploy, the &NFi;real&NFi_; ghosts decide to join the fun. Love enters the game when one of the tourists (Steve Guttenberg) becomes enamored with one of the ghosts (Daryl Hannah) in this comedy from writer-director Neil Jordan.
link.title: synopsis
The Magical Legend of the Leprechauns
Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest

link.synopsis: In a less-than-brilliant flight of fancy, the mayor decides that the Police Academy will now be open to any and all applicants. Of course, that opens the floodgates to a swarm of weirdos and losers who have no business protecting or serving anything. Steve Guttenberg stars in this zany comedy classic that spawned a rash of raucous sequels. This special edition includes the documentary "Behind Academy Doors: Secret Files Revealed."
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Anthony Edwards stars as likeable campus geek Jonathan, who's a master at the latest puerile college game in which undergraduates stalk and "bump off" their fellow students with paint guns. But his luck changes radically when he jets off to a vacation in Europe and meets an enigmatic Czech siren (Linda Fiorentino) who gets Jonathan entangled in global espionage. Director Jeff Kanew's knockabout comedy costars Alex Rocco and Marla Adams.
link.title: synopsis
The Man with One Red Shoe
Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control

link.synopsis: Although Masetto (Mario Parodi) wants to wait until he and his girlfriend, Lola (Anna Ammirati), are married to consummate their relationship, she's ready to get started now. Luckily for her, her mother's boyfriend dabbles in pornography. Director Tinto Brass delivers this titillating erotic comedy set in the Italian countryside of the 1950s, chronicling the tension between two young lovers as they flirt with premarital sex.
link.title: synopsis
Emanuelle and the White Slave Trade
Kama Sutra: A Tale of Love
Warm Water Under a Red Bridge

link.synopsis: Three best friends -- Paul (James Dreyfus), Matt (Michael Urwin) and Will (David Coffey) -- reunite for an extended weekend on the English seaside. But what should've been a simple, relaxing reunion becomes complicated when each of the friends brings a boyfriend -- and some serious emotional baggage. This bittersweet comedy examines each of the six men's personal issues, crafting a humorous exploration of gay life in the 1990s in the process.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of Boys in Love
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: Compay Segundo lived to be 100 years old and, during his long and fruitful career, performed with legendary Cuban musicians such as Miguel Matamoros and Beny Mor. But it wasn't until he participated in the recording of the classic album "The Buena Vista Social Club" that Segundo's fame broke out worldwide. This video includes Segundo's live performances of "La Negra Tomasa," "Huellas del Pasado," "Sarandonga," "Macusa" and much more.
link.title: synopsis
Tito Puente: King of Latin Music
Live Earth: The Concerts for a Climate in Crisis
Cuba Mia: Portrait of an All-Woman Orchestra
Shakira: Live and Off the Record
Chosen Few: El Documental II: Vol. 2
Paulo Bellinati Plays Antonio Carlos Jobim
Paquito D'Rivera & Chano Dominguez: Quartier Latin
Willy Chirino: En Vivo Desde Miami
Jam Miami: A Celebration of Latin Jazz

link.synopsis: This motion-comic series centers on the rustic Iowa community of Ogden Marsh, where a toxin in the water supply is infecting the minds and bodies of the town's residents -- and turning ordinary people into violent psychopaths.
link.title: synopsis
Robotech: The Shadow Chronicles: The Movie
Masters of Horror: Joe Dante: The Screwfly Solution
Now and Then, Here and There
Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex

link.synopsis: When their wildlife show is threatened with cancellation, host Peter Gaulke (Steve Zahn) and soundman Fred Wolf (Allen Covert) attempt to boost their flagging ratings by going in search of the most elusive beast of all: Bigfoot. But will the duo's big plan turn out to be just another hoax? Although this raucous comedy's main characters are named after real-life screenwriters Fred Wolf and Peter Gaulke, the events are purely fictional.
link.title: synopsis
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day

link.synopsis: Through the microcosm of campus life, director Spike Lee's offbeat comedy explores the biases, anxiety and frustration of black students at a faux university. Laurence Fishburne plays a devoted political activist, while his wanna-be frat-boy cousin (Lee) endures any degradation to pledge Gamma Phi. Based partially on Lee's collegiate experience, School Daze examines the social divide and intraracial conflict that exist within black schools.
link.title: synopsis
What's Love Got to Do with It

link.synopsis: In this double dose of the hit BBC comedy series, Patsy (Joanna Lumley) and Edina (Jennifer Saunders) travel to New York, where Edina's son Serge (Josh Hamilton) has been secretly living, and Saffy (Julia Sawalha) shares some major news: her very rich, very eligible boyfriend has proposed. "Absolutely Fabulous in New York" guest stars Deborah Harry and Rufus Wainwright; Marianne Faithfull plays God in "The Last Shout."
link.title: synopsis
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle

The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending

Two Fat Ladies: The Complete Collection

Are You Being Served?: The Movie
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 1
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler

The Funny Blokes of British Comedy

link.synopsis: Recorded in April 1971 at the famed Improv in New York City, this stand-up performance captures the early comedy stylings and no-holds-barred wit of funnyman Richard Pryor. The legendary bad boy riffs on a multitude of target-rich topics ranging from race relations to dysfunctional families. Also included is Pryor's immortal bit featuring a rap session between a "Wino Preacher" and "Willie the Junkie."
link.title: synopsis
Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip

link.synopsis: The life of struggling shutterbug Rebecca (Jenny McCarthy) goes into a tailspin when she catches her supermodel beau (Victor Webster) in the sack with another woman. Rebecca, on the advice of her friends -- witless would-be actress Carrie (Kim Heskin) and hip-hop hairdresser Michelle (Carmen Electra) -- dives into the dating pool looking for love … and to make her ex jealous. But Rebecca's plan soon proves disastrous in this ribald sex comedy.

Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Comedian extraordinaire Dave Chappelle hosts this remarkable block party shot in Brooklyn, N.Y., featuring performances by Kanye West, Mos Def and many others. Neighbors and friends are treated to Chappelle's freshest comedy bits, and the whole block gets up and grooves to the live sounds of Talib Kweli, Common, Dead Prez, Erykah Badu, Jill Scott, The Roots, Cody ChesnuTT, Big Daddy Kane and the reunited Fugees.

link.synopsis: After a freak accident lodges a nail in uninsured Alice Eckle's (Jessica Biel) head, her crusade for health care takes her to Capitol Hill. But with her injury causing wild sexual urges, things are bound to get out of control in this romantic comedy. As naive congressman Howard Birdwell (Jake Gyllenhaal) takes up her cause, sparks fly between Alice and the young senator. But will love and politics make uneasy bedfellows?
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
The Men Who Stare at Goats
Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut

link.synopsis: A star-studded cast including Amanda Seyfried, Gillian Anderson, Alan Cumming, Heather Graham, Stellan Skarsgård and Christopher Lee brings the eccentricities of the London art scene to life in this character-driven comedy. The film is based on Danny Moynihan's book, which takes its title from Piet Mondrian's iconic painting, and the plot centers on the painting: who has it -- and who wants to get it.
link.title: synopsis
The Good, the Bad, the Weird
My Son, My Son, What Have Ye Done

link.synopsis: Childhood friends Abhay Gulathi (Imran Khan) and Aaliya Khan (Deepika Padukone) turn into teenage paramours in this romantic comedy that throws plenty of obstacles in the young lovers' paths as they find their way in the world and back to each other. While Aaliya wants nothing more than to be with Abhay, his beloved pictures herself on a larger stage, as a famous actress. She goes to Australia to study; he follows unbidden; fireworks ensue.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: Think The Odd Couple for the octogenarian set. Walter Matthau and George Burns have never been better (or more cantankerous) as two faded vaudeville legends -- Lewis and Clark -- who reteam for a television special about the history of comedy. Trouble is, the two geezers can't stand each other. Matthau and Burns are wonderful to watch in this vintage comedy penned by Neil Simon and directed by Herbert Ross.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Get ready for outrageous comedy that blasts the boundaries of political correctness. The laughs are fast and furious in this irreverent sketch comedy show featuring Aziz Ansari, Rob Huebel and Paul Scheer.

link.synopsis: Oscar-nominated and Emmy-winning filmmaker Liz Garbus follows four patients from JFK Medical Center for the first year after coming out of comas in HBO's gripping examination of traumatic brain injury. As each person emerges into a semiconscious state or beyond, Garbus traces their progress, their treatment by doctors and therapists, and the efforts and experiences of the families and friends who stand by them.

Autopsy: Postmortem with Dr. Michael Baden
I Am a Promise: The Children of Stanton Elementary School
A Father ... a Son ... Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
The First 48: The Most Intense Investigations

link.synopsis: Driven to distraction by a dog yapping endlessly in a nearby apartment, Yun-ju (Sung-jae Lee) -- a college lecturer who's already stressed by his pregnant wife's (Ho-jung Kim) nagging and his slim chances of landing a professorship -- takes action to silence the animal. Soon other dogs in the apartment complex fall strangely quiet, and the landlord's bookkeeper (Doona Bae) sets out to find out why. Joon-ho Bong directs this dark comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Woman Is the Future of Man
I'm a Cyborg, but That's Ok
